channel.title: How to mess with websites
channel.description:
[size=20pt]hello this is imjohn's tutorial on how to mess with websites...[/size]
i will use Google for this example
[hr]
first go on Google and right click then go to view source
[IMG]http://i118.photobucket.com/albums/o105/santaselfboy/pic1.jpg[/img]
open the source window and press "ctrl+f" look for the box below and type what the button says...
[IMG]http://i118.photobucket.com/albums/o105/santaselfboy/pic2.jpg[/img]
now look at the code it should say something like "<input name=btnG type=submit value="Google Search">" for this example it must have "type=submit" or it is the wrong button
[IMG]http://i118.photobucket.com/albums/o105/santaselfboy/pic3.jpg[/img]
now put this code in the address bar but don't press go
[code]javascript: {document.getElementById('name').value = ("new value")} alert('Done');[/code]
now where it say "name" you type the the name of the button which is btng... (<input name=btnG type=submit value="Google Search">)
then where it says new value type what you want it to say
now you should have a code like this
[code]javascript: {document.getElementById('btng').value = ("imjohn10's example")} alert('Done');[/code]
[IMG]http://i118.photobucket.com/albums/o105/santaselfboy/pic4.jpg[/img]
then press go....a message box will appear if you did it right and the google search button text should have changed
[IMG]http://i118.photobucket.com/albums/o105/santaselfboy/pic5.jpg[/img]

item.title: How to mess with websites
item.dc:creator: @VB7_Rocks VB7 Rocks
item.description:
@VB7_Rocks wrote:

[quote=“i–own–i, post:17, topic:62122”][quote author=imjohn10 link=topic=89623.msg948215#msg948215 date=1172686290]
if you just wanna piss about tho you can go on any web site and type this in

javascript:document.body.contentEditable='true';document.designMode='on'; void 0

[/quote]

What does that do ?[/quote]

Try it and find out

(It makes it so you can drag like images and stuff around on the page and type and edit it, but it doesn’t allow you to save the page or anything. It’s just for fun.)

Read full topic

item.title: How to mess with websites
item.dc:creator: @r4ndom1 r4ndom1
item.description:
@r4ndom1 wrote:

bowserjr2:

Opera is better to do things like this.

Opera is way too over bloated for my liking just install firebug firefox extension which does the job without loads of unessecary crap.

Oh yeah and check out hackthissite.org lots of browser based challenges like this which are lots of fun also the articles will help you learn a lot.

Read full topic

item.title: How to mess with websites
item.dc:creator: @nicatron nicatron
item.description:
@nicatron wrote:

[quote=“Hippie_Slay, post:11, topic:62122”]ok now im gettting this error msg whenever i search on any search engine(ie google, yahoo etc)

File not found

Firefox can’t find the file at /res/[xpconnect wrapped nsIURI].

*   Check the file name for capitalization or other typing errors.

*   Check to see if the file was moved, renamed or deleted.[/quote]

I did this too and it screwed up moparisthebest.com\smf so i did this
code
Tools > Clear private data >
check it all except saved passes
this will shut the JS down lol

Read full topic

@imjohn10 wrote:

[size=20pt]hello this is imjohn’s tutorial on how to mess with websites…[/size]

i will use Google for this example

[hr]

first go on Google and right click then go to view source

open the source window and press “ctrl+f” look for the box below and type what the button says…

now look at the code it should say something like “”
for this example it must have “type=submit” or it is the wrong button

now put this code in the address bar but don’t press go

javascript: {document.getElementById('name').value = ("new value")} alert('Done');

now where it say “name” you type the the name of the button which is btng…
()

then where it says new value type what you want it to say

now you should have a code like this

javascript: {document.getElementById('btng').value = ("imjohn10's example")} alert('Done');

then press go…a message box will appear if you did it right and the google search button text should have changed
